title: Why the assassin rework was unfair
body: Adding delayed damage to assassins was, and still is a good idea, you should be able to react before dying. Where the problem lies is that other classes can still delete you without delay. Right now, if you want to fulfill the fantasy of oneshotting someone, you might as well play a mage, or heck even an adc. Oh look, Lux landed a Q on you and has her skills up? Rip. Vayne as Infinity Edge, and static shiv? You better not get auto attacked 3 times! Caitlyn landed her net on you and autoed you? Rip half your health. Meanwhile Leblanc has the time to die 3 times before she can proc her mark.

For some reason riot wanted to add this idea that delaying burst makes it fair, but it doesnt because assassin will have to be either tanky, which is why we got assassins like bruiser shaco, or the burst is way to much like fizz and leblanc. Lux has a lot of drawbacks come late game.

Find an ADC alone?  ADC flashes over her Q, and it doesn't matter if she also has flash or not, she's dead either way.

Find an ADC that's not alone?  ADC gets hit by Q, but locket/shields make them survive her burst, now she's useless.

Then you have Guardian Angel and Zhonyas completely invalidating her combo.

Lux can be very powerful midgame but there's many, many games where she just becomes useless and there's nothing she can do anymore.

The problem with assassins wasn't that they could erase you, it was that they could erase you and then dash away to safety with insane mobility.

Veigar might be able to delete you late game with zero counter-play but he's likely going to die immediately after if your team can follow up in any way, as he has no escape. 

There are some outliers to this concept,mostly to be found in the bruiser-carry section, but that's a problem with specific champions, not classes. Thus it's not relevant to the topic.

Edit- And let's not act like lengthening their burst patterns was a Nerf. Lowering damage allowed Riot to implement insane bullshit like stealth ignoring pink wards. I would take old Shaco and Rengar in a heartbeat since you could at least see them entering your lane.

On the other hand they have the best mobility in game class wise, or at least this is the current concept design. Even if it's delayed and other classes have an instant burst, they can't still be compared, since they can literally jump around and dodge everything while killing you, while Lux can't.
That's the reason why assassin is the most mechanically intensive class and one of the most difficult decision making ones.

I personally like stuff like Zed's ult and Fizz's ult.  Both are very obviously their strong damage part.  You can outplay it, they can outplay with it.  It is delayed, giving your said time to outplay it, and it doesn't really throw them into the middle of a fight (Zed's does, but most don't just run in and ult the minute a teamfight starts unless it's to dodge something).  

Leblanc's is sorta forced in my opinion, especially since it doesn't get shorter with CDR or anything.  Yeah, it was completely BS how before Leblanc would literally W, Q, E, and then pop back to CSing while you now have 50% hp.  Plus the fact she has a delay on being able to reapply her passive now just means she's essentially a poke mage, not an assassin.  If her passive didn't have a target cooldown, Leblanc could use W to gap close, land E which popped her passive, QRQ to pop passive again and she would be able to actually burst people with the delay still being present.  Or you could change it so that after she's hits 6 and she procs the passive, her abilities do an extra bit of damage during the cooldown period.  That way there is a delay to allow you to outplay, and then burst if you don't.

Also her passive delay isn't lowered in gamemodes like URF, which seems really unfair considering everyone can spam but your spam literally has a forced delay.

It's also completely unfair that an ADC gets 3 crits in a row and you instantly die even if you have armor.  With Lux at least she had to hit a slow moving skillshot first.  Caitlyn I feel depends, because you had to be pretty close to be hit by said net but eating a trap you literally can't see (hidden behind teammate, under dead bodies, randomly invisible, etc) I'll agree is bullshit though.

It's actually hard to find an example. They changed a lot of assassins to be healthy. LB can't instaburst you from off screen anymore. Katarina has clear zones of power that you can't infringe upon and she can't randomly just pop in and erase you. Rengar was nerfed. Talon was changed. 

But the issue used to be that you just died. Like, from off screen, an assassin appears behind you through stealth or mobility and just pops you and you have to take it. You should be able to see it coming and move away. One second you're playing the next you're not. With Varus you can stay out of his AA range or trade with him if you can win. It might not have been much of a choice but it was a choice. He can't force a fight on you. You have to choose to fight. Same with Caitlyn and Lux. 

With old Rengar or anyone else really, they chose the fight and you didn't know you were fighting till you were already dead. 

It wasn't fair. But now it is, I'd argue
